title: Transformation of E coli. with Heat Shock
original description: Transformation of heat-shock competent E. coli cells. Adapted to fit he protocol followed by Northeastern_Boston
steps:
None
1. Thaw the appropriate amount of competent cells on ice.
2. Pre-chill the required number of empty 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tubes.
3. Pipet 50 µl aliquots of cells into the pre-chilled tubes.
4. Add 5-10 µl of a ligation reaction mix or 5 ng of pure plasmid DNA to each tube. Mix gently!
5. Incubate the tubes of ice for 30 min 
1800s
6. Heat shock the cells for 45 sec at 42°C 
45s
7. Place the tubes immediately on ice for at least 2 min 
120s
8. Add 800 µl of SOC medium to each tube and incubate for 1 hour at 37°C 
3600s
9. Transfer the cultures to 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tubes and spin for 1 min at 6000 rpm. 
60s
10. Remove 800 µl of the supernatant and resuspend the pellet.
11. Plate out the suspension on a LB agar plate containing the appropriate antibiotic.
12. Incubate the plates overnight at 37°C.
